page.title: 11Transport-road and traffic
page.content: Leighton/Linslade is close to the M1. This enables many people to commute by car to places of work in the surrounding areas, Bus services are very poor, only one bus linking Soulbury to Leighton on Tuesdays only. Traffic congestion is a major concern for people in Leighton/Linslade. An action group, TRAC, has been fighting for a town by-pass for 9 years. More than double the number of vehicles use the Leighton/Linslade bridge per traffic lane than the M1. It is hoped that the by-pass will be started next year and then 58% of the traffic should use it. However 2300 commercial vehicles will still be based in the town. The haulage trade has flourished in the area hauling bricks, sand and cement, 23 haulage companies being based in the town.
